column3: per state media
column4: aim to lower energy intensity by 13. 5% and carbon emissions intensity by 18% — that is
column5: measures of energy use and emissions relative to economic output. Get market news worthy of your time with Axios Markets.  Subscribe for free. It also aims to have its share of energy from non-fossil fuels at 20% by 2025. Yes
column8: called the plan an ""indecisive signal"" that simply incorporates China's existing intentions. ""These targets represent the intention of the Chinese government to implement the climate announcement made by President Xi Jinping at the Climate Ambition Summit last December.  But they do not go further than that
column9: he said in a brief analysis. ""The plan also defers key questions of how China intends to accelerate its decarbonization into the future
column10: Li wrote. ""We were hoping for more answers on climate issues
column11: but what we got are more questions
column12: he told the Financial Times. Why it matters: China is by far the world's largest carbon emitter. The country pledged in September to have its emissions peak before 2030 and achieve carbon neutrality by 2060
column13: but concrete steps toward those goals remain hazy at best. And
column15: the plan ""did not mention any ban on new coal projects
column16: which experts say would be a significant step. ""What we're watching: The relative absence of new info raises the stakes of Biden administration moves to secure stronger efforts in forthcoming diplomacy — including the climate summit the White House is convening next month. Li

column1: 2021-03-05 15:09:07#tech#Apex Legends will soon let you solo queue
column2: but don't expect a fair fight#https://www.pcgamer.com/apex-legends-will-soon-let-you-solo-queue-but-dont-expect-a-fair-fight/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/GxqCLp4x6ToqCzrm2cckwd-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0857#www.pcgamer.com#"We've all been there.  You've just dropped into a match of Apex Legends
column3: only to find one of your squadmates has sprinted off on their lonesome
column4: ready to solo every other team on the battlefield—leaving the other two at a disadvantage.  Fortunately
column5: Apex will soon let these lone wolves queue up without hindering a team
column6: but be warned—this isn't exactly a proper solos mode. Chaos Theory
column8: is adding a ""No Fill"" toggle
column9: letting Apex know that you don't want your squad filled out with strangers.  So yeah
column10: play solo if you want.  Just know that you'll still be pitting yourself against two- or three-person teams.  Hey
column11: maybe you're just that good. Respawn has toyed with temporary solo modes in the past
column12: but isn't too keen on making in a permanent option.  No-fill
column14: is an attempt to compromise with the hotshots out there who want to test their luck while still retaining the game's team spirit. ""We still strongly believe that
column16: Apex Legends is a game about teamplay.  But we’re launching this No-Fill matchmaking as an option for solo players because we think it gives a lot of creative opportunities for you to play the game your way. """#https://www.pcgamer.com/apex-legends-will-soon-let-you-solo-queue-but-dont-expect-a-fair-fight/#mJuSm0Ocj

2021-03-04 22:26:25#world#Why white supremacists and QAnon enthusiasts are obsessed - but very wrong - about the Byzantine Empire#https://news.yahoo.com/why-white-supremacists-qanon-enthusiasts-222625204.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/eAjNqzy2HyqaMRobhevT4A--~B/aD05NzA7dz0xNDQwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_conversation_us_articles_815/f84c3030b86ece867db5c69df48b6b53#en#-0.6946#news.yahoo.com#Inspiration for a mob of angry white men? Getty ImagesFrom Charlottesville to the Capitol
column2: medieval imagery has been repeatedly on show at far-right rallies and riots in recent years.  Displays of Crusader shields and tattoos derived from Norse and Celtic symbols are of little surprise to medieval historians like me who have long documented the appropriation of the Middle Ages by today’s far right.  But amid all the expected Viking imagery and nods to the Crusaders has been another dormant “medievalism” that has yet to be fully acknowledged in reporting on both the far right and conspiracy theorist movements: the Byzantine Empire.  Byzantium – or more properly
column3: the medieval Roman Empire – controlled much of the Mediterranean at the height of its territorial rule in the mid-sixth century.  Centered in modern-day Istanbul from A. D.  330 to 1453
column4: its capital of Constantinople was a thriving intellectual
column5: political and military power.  One of its crowning achievements
column7: is a testament to the empire’s architectural and artistic prowess.  The Hagia Sofia stands as a testament to Byzantium’s achievements.  Salvator Barki/Getty Images But in the Western world
column8: the Byzantine Empire has been largely overlooked and forgotten.  High school students in the United States are likely to know little about the empire.  And nowadays
column9: the word “byzantine” has simply come to mean complicated
column10: secret and bureaucratic.  This lowering of its status isn’t entirely a new process.  As far back as 1776
column11: English historian Edward Gibbon was disparagingly referring to the empire’s inhabitants as “the servile and effeminate Greeks of Byzantium. ” A ‘New Byzantium’ Despite this modern disdain for Byzantium in the West
column12: it has recently served as an inspiration to various factions of the far right.  In September 2017
column14: an American neo-Nazi who helped organize the “Unite the Right” rally in Charlottesville
column16: inaugurated a new supremacist group called “The New Byzantium” project.  Described by Kessler as “a premier organization for pro-white advocacy in the 21st century
column17: ” The New Byzantium is based on the white supremacist leader’s misrepresentation of history.  His premise is that when Rome fell
column18: the Byzantine Empire went on to preserve a white-European civilization.  This isn’t true.  In reality the empire was made up of diverse peoples who walked the streets of its capital
column19: coming from as far away as Nubia
column21: Syria and North Africa.  Contemporaneous sources noted – at times with disdain – the racial and ethnic diversity of both Constantinople and the empire’s emperors.  But Kessler’s “New Byzantium” is intended to preserve white dominance after what he calls “the inevitable collapse of the American Empire. ” The organization has been operating under the radar since 2017 with little online footprint.  The original ‘deep state’ Kessler isn’t alone in appropriating the empire.  Through my research
column22: I have monitored references of Byzantium in online forums.  Mentions of Byzantium are scattered across message boards frequented by both white supremacists and QAnon enthusiasts – who spout conspiracy theories about a deep-state cabal of Satan-worshipping
column23: blood-drinking pedophiles running the world.  Across 8kun and other online platforms I have reviewed
column24: the Byzantine Empire is discussed as either continuing the legacy of Rome after it was
column26: “destroyed by the Jews” or being the only true empire
column27: with Rome being merely a historical myth created to degrade Byzantium’s power and importance.  This latter story emerges in a QAnon thread on “Baking” – that is
column28: the connecting and weaving together of drops (messages) by the enigmatic Q.  One post states: “It all makes sense when you learn that the books of the bible are plagiarized copies of the chronology of Byzantium
column29: and so is the mythical Roman Empire
column30: that never existed in Italy but was in fact centered in Constantinople. ” Other QAnon commentators across message boards and Twitter speak of the “exiled throne of Byzantium
column33: it just went occult. ” They exclaim “Long live Byzantium” and call for a “return to Byzantium” to save people from the satanists.  Oddly
column34: while some hold up the Byzantine Empire as the vanguard of white supremacy
column35: a smaller group of white supremacists and conspiracy theorists sees it as “the original Deep State. ” In some renditions
column37: by way of some hazy illuminati connections
column38: the origins of the “deep state” – the myth of an underground cabal of elites who run the world in secret.  It has persisted in secrecy since Constantinople’s fall
column39: either trading in eunuchs on the clandestine market or preserving whiteness and Christianity
column40: depending on the thread’s negative or positive outlook on the empire.  Reconquest of Hagia Sophia For many on the far right
column41: talk of Byzantium is cloaked in Islamophobia – both online and in tragic real-life events.  A white supremacist who killed more than 50 worshippers at mosques in Christchurch
column43: in 2019 railed against the Turks and the conquest of Constantinople in a 74-page manifesto.  “We are coming for Constantinople
column44: and we will destroy every mosque and minaret in the city.  The Hagia Sophia will be free of minarets and Constantinople will be rightfully Christian owned once more
column45: ” the shooter wrote.  Throughout QAnon message boards
column46: the reconquest of Hagia Sophia is emblematic of the destruction of Islam and the restoration of a mythic white Byzantium.  One post stated: “When we free Constantinople and the Hagia Sophia
column47: maybe we can talk. ” ‘Third Rome’ This “reconquest” of Constantinople had even been tied in some online posts to the presidency of Donald Trump
column48: with images circulated online seemingly prophesying that it would happen under his tenure.  In one image
column49: Trump is seen congratulating Russian President Vladimir Putin “on the retaking of Constantinople” and shaking hands in front of what is presumably meant to be the Hagia Sophia
column50: though is actually the Sultan Ahmed Mosque
column51: also known as the Blue Mosque.  Putin himself is not averse to drawing on the symbolism of Byzantium.  The Russian state has long tried to position itself as the rightful successor to the Byzantine Empire
column52: with Moscow as the “Third Rome. ” This forms part of a religious and political doctrine tied to Russian territorial expansion that can be traced back as far as the late 15th century.  The far-right appropriation of Byzantium in the U. S.  appears to be influenced by this Russian interpretation.  Indeed
column53: Russian proponents of the “Third Rome” doctrine have been cited as influences by prominent figures on the American right.  No matter the provenance of the recent interest in Byzantium from America’s white supremacists and conspiracy theorists
column54: one thing is clear: It is based on a very warped idea of the Byzantine Empire that has emerged out of the empire’s fraught place in our histories

2021-03-04 19:55:34#world#Earthquake swarm in Iceland could hint at even bigger event#https://news.yahoo.com/earthquake-swarm-iceland-could-hint-195534546.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Nth48RuIOu28ZGGXhNi8Fg--~B/aD0zNjY7dz02NTA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/accuweather_297/4f2378d4154ec80ad881869347f81196#en#0.0#news.yahoo.com#"Nearly constant earthquakes have plagued the main population center of Iceland in recent days
column2: and officials warn this could be a sign of an imminent volcanic eruption.  Iceland is no stranger to seismic activity as the island has been formed by volcanic activity due to the North American and Eurasian tectonic plates moving away from each other.  Iceland is home to volcanoes
column3: geysers
column4: hot springs
column5: lava fields and occasional earthquakes.  However
column6: the islands are experiencing unusual seismic activity with over 18
column7: 000 earthquakes occurring over the past week.  According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS)
column8: a series of mostly small earthquakes with identifiable main shock is considered a swarm and can be short-lived or continue for days
column9: months or years.  2/2 Turbulence and seismic activity decreased in the middle of the night
column10: but increased again around 05:00. Largest earthquakes since midnight:00:59 M4. 1 at Fagradalsfjall04:04 M3
column11: 605:17 M3. 905:56 M3. 905:44 M4. 015-20 earthquakes over magnitude 3 detected since midnight.  pic. twitter. com/BTemiechzb— Icelandic Meteorological Office - IMO (@Vedurstofan) March 4
column12: 2021 Earthquakes in a swarm happen in roughly the same area and are associated with geothermal activity.  Most of the earthquakes have occurred in the Southern Peninsula
column14: located to the south of the capital city of Reykjavik.  About two-thirds of Iceland's population lives in Reykjavik and the surrounding towns.  CLICK HERE FOR THE FREE ACCUWEATHER APP Locals told CNN that while they are used to earthquakes in the area
column15: the almost constant shaking has been unsettling.  Most of the earthquakes have had a magnitude of 3. 0 or less on the Richter Scale.  However
column16: the largest tremors reached a magnitude of 5. 2 on Feb.  27 and 5. 6 on Feb.  24.  Outside of a few cracks in roads and rockfalls on steep slopes near the epicenter of the swarm reported by Iceland's Road and Coastal Administration
column17: very little damage has been caused by the frequent earthquakes
column22: near the Volcano Katla.  (AP Photo/Frank Augstein
column23: File) Local experts that CNN spoke with about the lengthy period of seismic activity said concerns among the public make sense.  ""Of course it worries people
column25: a volcanology professor at the University of Iceland
column28: not because of the type of earthquakes or their intensity
column29: but for their duration.  It's been going for more than a week now. "" Þórðarson went on to say that the frequent earthquakes are likely due to an intrusion of magma into the Earth's crust in the Reykjanes region and that officials are trying to figure out if the magma is moving even closer to the surface.  There are multiple volcanoes located along this southwestern peninsula
column30: including Mount Keilir which is located about 20 miles south of Reykjavik
column31: and local officials warn that an eruption could be imminent.  ""We are not saying we have signs an eruption has begun
column33: an official from the Icelandic Meteorological Office
column34: told local media.  ""But this looks like the type of activity we expect in the run-up to an eruption. "" According to The Guardian
column35: officials announced that residents were not in any immediate danger
column36: but travel to the peninsula should be avoided.  Officials also stated this would be the first eruption in this region of Iceland since the 12th century
column37: according to The Guardian.  The fears of an eruption come during an active period for volcanoes elsewhere around the world.  Both Mount Etna in Italy and Mount Sinabung in Indonesia have been particularly active in recent weeks.  Each volcano sent towering ash clouds into the sky this week
column38: which left villages in both countries coated in ash.  No injuries or fatalities were reported as a result of either eruption
column39: but air travel was impacted for a period of time in Italy's Sicily region
column40: which is where the volcano is located.  Keep checking back on AccuWeather. com and stay tuned to the AccuWeather Network on DirecTV

S.  Treasury on Thursday launched a new program to infuse $9 billion into minority and community lenders to boost financing for small businesses and consumers struggling with the coronavirus pandemic in low-income and underserved communities.  The Emergency Capital Investment Program
column2: funded as part of a $900 billion COVID-19 aid bill signed into law at the end of 2020 by former president Donald Trump
column3: will provide $9 billion in capital to Community Development Financial Institutions (CDFIs) and minority depositary institutions.  These institutions
column4: from small mortgage lenders to minority-owned banks and rural credit unions and other lenders
column5: will be able to increase loans and grants to their communities and extend forbearance to struggling customers
